snippet: Two women from the Russian punk group said they had no fear of prison and suggested they may even run for political office in Russia someday.
abstract: Maria Alyokhina and Nadezhda Tolokonnikova, from Russian punk group Pussy Riot, say their 21-month incarceration in Russia’s penal system for staging political protest in Moscow cathedral has emboldened them to speak out more forcefully against Pres Vladimir V Putin; say impetus to speak out has come partly from amount of global support they received, and suggest they may one day run for political office in Russia.

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: Two women from the Russian punk group said they had no fear of prison and suggested they may even run for political office in Russia someday.

headline.main: Pussy Riot Members Take Tour to New York
headline.print_headline: Pussy Riot Members Take Tour to New York

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
